intro: Crudia gossweileri, commonly known as the Gossweiler's burr, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
